result.execSummary:
The defendant BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER
Current: 555 W. John St Apt 206, Markesan, WI 53946 United States  (Effective: 05-02-2022)
Prior: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States

1:21 PM Defendant BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Curtis Paul Julka in court for BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER on 2021CM197, Attorney Michael Kapelis in court for BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER on 2022CM1. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement in 2021CM197 - defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2 with probation and conditions and counts 3 & 4 will be dismissed and read-in. DA concurs. Atty Julka concurs. Defendant concurs. Court recites agreement in 2022CM1 - defendant will plea to counts 2 & 3 with jail, costs and DNA sample. DA concurs and restitution. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over both plea questionnaires with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty in 2021CM197 to counts 1 & 2 as charged and orders counts 3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in; in 2022CM1 court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2 & 3 as charged and orders counts 1 & 4 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Statement by defendant's parents Pamela S & Brian S. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Sentencing statement by Atty Julka. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CM197 (Count 1 & Count 2)

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.  
-No violent contact with the victim.
-AODA & any follow-up
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

2022CM1 (Count 2 & Count 3)

-116 days county jail and 116 days of sentence credit.
-Court Costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Further statement by the Court re: victim impact statement. 
Bond to be applied to all of the court costs in these cases.

Court adjourned at 1:44 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER. Atty Kapelis states he has the Discovery and a global offer and requests a plea & sentencing. Atty Kapelis further states that Atty Julka represents the defendant on the other case. Court sets for plea & sentencing on April 26, 2022 at 1:00 PM
Review hearing on April 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pretrial Status Report

10:49 AM Defendant BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond modification. DA Laspisa objects to bond modification. DA Laspisa confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Court asks if anybody present wishes to address the Court. Def's father is present and wishes to address the Court. Statement by the defendant's father. Further statement by DA Laspisa. Statement by the Court. Court denies motion to modify bond.

Court adjourned at 10:52 AM.
Motion hearing on February 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

State's
Return date on March 8, 2022 at 08:00 am.

9:56 AM Defendant BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared by video for BRIAN Z SCHOENECKER, Attorney Bradford Paul Bollmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant. Court notes bond has been set. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond. Court denies request for modification and keeps bond as it. Court will set for Return Date on March 8, 2022 at 8:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:00 AM
